query: Billy sells DVDs. He has 8 customers on Tuesday. His first 3 customers buy one DVD each.  His next 689566 customers buy 689566 DVDs each.  His last 3 customers don't buy any DVDs. How many DVDs did Billy sell on Tuesday?

### Revised Answer Example:

[Reasoning Process] 
To determine how many DVDs Billy sold on Tuesday, we first identify the total number of customers, which is 8. The first 3 customers each buy one DVD, resulting in 3 DVDs sold. The mention of "689566 customers" seems to be an error since it exceeds the total customer count. Therefore, these customers cannot exist in this context. The last 3 customers do not buy any DVDs. [Verification]

[Final Answer] The answer is 3 \n#### 3
